result.execSummary:
The defendant Rebecca L Nichols was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: Penalty - Theft >$2500-$5000], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution, costs, fees, and surcharge shall be paid as a condition of probation in case no.: 14CF560.   If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Restitution, costs, fees, and surcharge shall be paid as a condition of probation in case no.: 14CF560.   If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

Court authorizes a transfer to a jail that is convenient to the defendants residence.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Def in person & by Atty Nadya E Perez-Reyes.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Joint recommendation; Statements from State, Counsel; Court proceeds to sentencing.
Sentencing hearing on March 18, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Def in person & by Atty Nadya E Perez-Reyes.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Resolution reached.  No contest plea entered.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  Sentencing recommendations:  9 mos. jail w/Huber; $518 court costs; $3,075 restitution plus 10%; DNA sample.  Sentencing adjourned.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Hearing on March 4, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Nadya E Perez-Reyes.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  One more adjournment requested to allow pretrial; new offer pending.  Hearing scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Case assigned to Br. 3; Arraignment scheduled for 12-17-14 at 9:45 a.m.
